passage:
(1) Many people have different jobs. Some people work in offices, while others work outside. Teachers work in schools and help students learn new things. Doctors work in hospitals and help sick people get better. Some people drive buses or taxis to take others where they need to go.

(2) Some jobs are in shops and restaurants. Shop assistants help customers find what they want to buy. Chefs make food in restaurants. Waiters bring food to people's tables. Farmers grow food on farms. They grow vegetables and fruit, or they keep animals like cows and chickens.

(3) Some people have jobs where they make things. Builders make houses and other buildings. Carpenters make things from wood, like tables and chairs. Tailors make clothes. Artists make paintings, and musicians make music. Writers write books and stories for others to read.

(4) Today, many people work with computers. They write programs or help fix computer problems. Some people work from home using the internet. Other people travel for their jobs and visit different places. Some jobs are difficult and dangerous, like being a firefighter or a police officer. All jobs are important because they help our communities work well.

questions.question: Which form of the verb is correct? She ____ to school every day.

options.A: They not are going to the party.

options.C: They going not to the party.
options.D: Not they are going to the party.
